    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InteractiveFrame(Scene scn)
      Constructs a interactive-frame and adds to the Scene.models() collection.
      InteractiveFrame(Scene scn, Frame referenceFrame)
      Constructs an interactive-frame as a child of reference frame, and adds it to the Scene.models() collection.
      InteractiveFrame(Scene scn, Frame referenceFrame, Object obj, String methodName)
      Wraps the the function object procedure into this interactive-frame which is is created as a child of reference frame and then added to the Scene.models() collection.
      InteractiveFrame(Scene scn, Frame referenceFrame, PShape ps)
      Wraps the pshape into this interactive-frame which is created as a child of reference frame and then added to the Scene.models() collection.

      Wraps the function object procedure into this interactive-frame which is then added it to the Scene.models() collection.

      Wraps the pshape into this interactive-frame which is then added to the Scene.models() collection.
      InteractiveFrame(Scene scn, PShape ps, PImage texture)

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGraphicsHandler(Object obj, String methodName)
      Attempt to add a graphics handler method to the InteractiveFrame.
      void applyTransformation(PGraphics pg)
      Same as ((Scene) scene).applyTransformation(pg, this).
      void applyWorldTransformation(PGraphics pg)
      Same as ((Scene) scene).applyWorldTransformation(pg, this).
      boolean checkIfGrabsInput(float x, float y)
      An interactive-frame is selected using 'ray-picking' with a color buffer (see Scene.pickingBuffer()).
      InteractiveFrame detach()
      Returns a copy of this frame preserving its Frame.position(), Frame.orientation() and Frame.magnitude(), but discarding its Frame.referenceFrame() and Frame.children().
      void draw()
      Same as draw(scene.pg()).
      boolean draw(PGraphics pg)
      While displaying a model requires the drawing to be rendered into Scene.pg(), picking requires it to be rendered into Scene.pickingBuffer() (see Scene.drawModels() and Scene.drawModels(PGraphics), resp.).
      boolean equals(Object obj) 
      InteractiveFrame get()
      Returns a deep copy of the object.
      boolean hasGraphicsHandler()
      Returns true if the user has registered a graphics handler method to the Scene and false otherwise.
      int hashCode() 
      PVector modelShift()
      Returns the shape() shift.
      void removeGraphicsHandler()
      Unregisters the graphics handler method (if any has previously been added to the Scene).

      Replaces previous shape() with ps.
      PShape shape()
      Returns the shape wrap by this interactive-frame.
      void shiftModel(PVector shift)
      Shifts the shape() respect to the frame Frame.position().
      PShape unsetShape()
      Unsets the shape which is wrapped by this interactive-frame.

      • checkIfGrabsInput

        public final boolean checkIfGrabsInput(float x,
                                       float y)
        An interactive-frame is selected using 'ray-picking' with a color buffer (see Scene.pickingBuffer()). This method compares the color of the Scene.pickingBuffer() at (x,y) with getColor(). Returns true if both colors are the same, and false otherwise.
        Overrides:
        checkIfGrabsInput in class GrabberFrame

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Same as draw(scene.pg()).
        See Also:
        Scene.drawModels(PGraphics)

      • draw

        public boolean draw(PGraphics pg)
        Description copied from interface: Model
        While displaying a model requires the drawing to be rendered into Scene.pg(), picking requires it to be rendered into Scene.pickingBuffer() (see Scene.drawModels() and Scene.drawModels(PGraphics), resp.).

        For an implementation refer to the ModelObject and InteractiveFrame classes.

        Returns true if succeeded and false otherwise.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface Model
        Parameters:
        pg - PGraphics buffer used to draw the PShape instance.
        See Also:
        Scene.drawModels(), Scene.drawModels(PGraphics)

      • addGraphicsHandler

        public void addGraphicsHandler(Object obj,
                               String methodName)
        Attempt to add a graphics handler method to the InteractiveFrame. The default event handler is a method that returns void and has one single PGraphics parameter. Note that the method should only deal with geometry and that not coloring procedure may be specified within it.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to handle the event
        methodName - the method to execute in the object handler class
        See Also:
        removeGraphicsHandler(), invokeGraphicsHandler(PGraphics)

      • removeGraphicsHandler

        public void removeGraphicsHandler()
        Unregisters the graphics handler method (if any has previously been added to the Scene).
        See Also:
        addGraphicsHandler(Object, String), invokeGraphicsHandler(PGraphics)

      • hasGraphicsHandler

        public boolean hasGraphicsHandler()
        Returns true if the user has registered a graphics handler method to the Scene and false otherwise.
        See Also:
        addGraphicsHandler(Object, String), invokeGraphicsHandler(PGraphics)
